title: Novelty Churn Manipulation
description: Detects when constant novelty, distraction, or 'new silliness' is introduced to exhaust attention, erode continuity, and prevent deep accountability.
indicators: Rapid stream of new narratives, tools, or crises with little resolution of previous ones
Energy disproportionately spent reacting to novelty instead of sustaining continuity
Patterns of accelerated rollout or policy shifts designed to destabilize focus
Framing of exhaustion as individual failure rather than systemic overload
